What are some of the unique capabilities of Verus PBaaS, and how do they enable a decentralized future with truth and privacy for all?

Verus PBaaS offers several capabilities that go beyond what is currently available in decentralized platforms. These capabilities are designed to provide a decentralized future with truth and privacy for all.

One of the unique capabilities of Verus PBaaS is the VerusID protocol, which enables self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable identities. This means that users can register friendly name strong identities and funds addresses that are fully under their control, and can be revoked and recovered if needed.

Another capability is the Verus Vault, which enables staking-capable time locking and theft prevention. This allows users to lock their identities, preventing any funds under their control from being spent while locked, but still allowing seamless staking of funds. The lock can be set with an unlock delay, which provides an additional layer of security against theft. The only way to circumvent the unlock delay is to revoke and recover an ID, and users can choose to create and use fresh private keys when unlocking an ID.

These capabilities enable a range of use cases, including virtually theft-proof workflows, solutions to inheritance, trusts, vesting schedules, and identity theft. VerusIDs can also be used as friendly name cryptocurrency addresses for all currencies on all Verus PBaaS blockchains in the Verus network.

Overall, Verus PBaaS is designed to provide a decentralized future with truth and privacy for all, and its unique capabilities make it an exciting development in the world of crypto.
